intro: Freycinetia louisiadensis, commonly known as the Lusiadensis palms, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Pacific islands of the Solomon Islands and the Bismarck Archipelago. This plant is a small to medium-sized palm, typically reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are pinnate, with long, narrow segments, and it produces yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fibrous drupe that contains a single seed.
